Found solution.
1.	Navigate to the folder specified in section 2.2

  2.	Create a file named "UserEngine.ini" in a text editor

  3.	Paste the following into UserEngine.ini

[Configuration]
BasedOn=..\S9Game\Config\DefaultEngine.ini

[Engine.Engine]
Language=XXX

go to create new account when there is a text like in games terms of agree scrooldown and there is a part of the text 2 words are blue click it and you are ready to play
To get the language to english go to your documentfiles/mygames folder find section 8 and the s8engine.ini file. Open up with notepad and change the language line from ITA to INT

"Games for Windows live failed to initialize" solution for COMODO INTERNET SECURITY:

 Open Comodo settings
 Goto Defense+ Tab
 Open Defense+ Settings
 Goto "Execution Control Settings" Tab
 Click on "Exclusions" for shellcode injections (Buffer overflow)
 Add S9.exe
 Add S9-Win32-F.exe from the Binaries directory
 Click "Apply"
...
 ;)

No retards, pirated games can not be played on multiplayer.

@filip080009

You'd have to make an offline account through Windows Live in-game to be able to save. If you haven't tried installing Resident Evil 5 on PC, then you'd encounter a similar problem.

@PonyJL

Yes they do, but that would require a better crack, if not more files added with the crack.
The game works just fine on Windows 7 x64. The game gives off only 21 fps upon benchmark testing though on this laptop I'm using. The game looks beautiful nonetheless.

@dothackjhe 
Any game with any proper multiplayer security (keys/logins) cannot be cracked, unless you use an external program to do multi player matches which means you cant play with people who actually own the game.
